contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Katherine Tingley.003.jpg|thumb|Katherine Tingley]] {{Theosophy}} '''Katherine Augusta Westcott Tingley''' (born July 6, 1847, [[Newbury, Massachusetts|Newbury]], [[Massachusetts]]; died July 11, 1929, [[VisingsÃ¶]], [[Sweden]]) was a [[social worker]] and prominent [[Theosophy|Theosophist]]. She was the leader, after W. Q. Judge, of the [[Theosophical Society Pasadena|American Section of the Theosophical Society]]. She founded and led the Theosophical community [[Lomaland]] in [[Point Loma]], [[California]]. Tingley grew up in [[Newbury, Massachusetts]]. She married Philo B. Tingley in 1888. She was working as a [[social worker]] in [[New York]] when she met [[William Quan Judge]]. She joined the [[Theosophical Society]] on October 13, 1894. In 1895, disputes between Judge and [[Annie Besant]] led to a split, with Judge taking most of the American section with him, and leading it for one year until his death in 1896. At that point Tingley became the new head of [[Theosophical Society Pasadena|the organization]], although her identity was concealed for one year. In 1898, a group of roughly 200 theosophists led by Ernest Temple Hargrove seceded from Tingley's organization, and formed a [[Theosophical Society in America (Hargrove)|rival group]] based in [[New York City]]. On February 13, 1900, she transferred the Society's international headquarters from [[New York City]] to a new colony she called [[Lomaland]], located in the [[Point Loma, San Diego|Point Loma]] community near [[San Diego]], [[California]]. Her settlement included Raja-Yoga School and College, Theosophical University, and the School for the Revival of the Lost Mysteries of Antiquity.<ref>[http://www.sandiegohistory.org/search/google/Katherine%20Tingley?query=Katherine%20Tingley&cx=016789698446270368612%3Ai66buwrua4i&cof=FORID%3A9&sitesearch=&hl=en&safe=off San Diego Historical Society: Katherine Tingley biography]</ref> After her death, her successors transferred the society, first to [[Covina, California]] and then later to [[Pasadena, California]] where it currently exists. ==References== <references /> ==See also== {{Commons category}} *[[Point Loma Nazarene University]] {{Authority control|VIAF=10462259}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Tingley, Katherine | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = American theosophist | DATE OF BIRTH = July 6, 1847 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH =July 11, 1929 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tingley, Katherine}} [[Category:1847 births]] [[Category:1929 deaths]] [[Category:American Theosophists]] [[Category:Founders of utopian communities]] {{US-reli-bio-stub}}
